meanings.sent1: Her solipsistic attitude made it difficult for her to consider other people's perspectives.
meanings.sent2: The artist's solipsistic approach to painting focused solely on his own emotions and experiences.
meanings.sent3: It was almost comical how solipsistic he was, always believing he was the only one who truly existed.
meanings.sent4: In a solipsistic world, everyone would be their own universe, isolated and self-contained.
meanings.sent5: The solipsistic nature of the protagonist made the novel a fascinating exploration of individual consciousness.

meanings.definition: Believing that oneself is all that exists or that other people's experiences are not real.
meanings.sent1: His solipsistic belief led him to dismiss the feelings and thoughts of others as insignificant.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher's solipsistic theory posited that only one's own mind can be truly known.
meanings.sent3: It's both amusing and concerning how solipsistic some individuals can be, completely unaware of the world around them.
meanings.sent4: Living in a solipsistic bubble, she failed to see the beauty and complexity of the interconnected world.
meanings.sent5: The solipsistic view of the character made the audience question the nature of reality and existence.
